title: ‚ôæÔ∏è DEFACTO
description: The DEFACTO project focuses on developing a DevOps pipeline for software development in rail vehicles. The goal is to support the entire development process‚Äîfrom planning and implementation to the deployment of new features‚Äîthrough automated testing and development steps. Once the pipeline is successfully completed, the software can be automatically deployed to real rail vehicles.

title: üöÅ 5URVIVE
description: The 5URVIVE project supports first responders in emergency situations‚Äîsuch as a heart attack in hard-to-reach terrain‚Äîby using UAVs (unmanned aerial vehicles) to quickly deliver life-saving equipment like defibrillators. These UAVs are designed to autonomously navigate to the incident location and interact with first responders on site. The project's aim is to make emergency response chains more efficient and faster.

title: üöÜ Gazebo Train
description: The Gazebo Train project involves creating a digital twin of a rail vehicle using ROS2 and Gazebo. Equipped with LiDAR sensors, camera systems, and inertial measurement units (IMUs), the virtual train can realistically perceive its surroundings. This enables testing and optimization of concepts for automated driving and assistance systems in simulation before real-world deployment.

title: üé≤ Monopoly World
description: This project simulates the electronic bank and card reader for Monopoly World. It allows 2 to 8 players to buy, sell properties, and pay rent just like in the classic game. A quick and convenient solution if your game‚Äôs batteries or device are not working.
